metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: In a DTD, attributes are declared with an ATTLIST declaration.
content.html: In a DTD, attributes are declared with an ATTLIST declaration.

content.text: An attribute declaration has the following syntax:
content.html: An attribute declaration has the following syntax:

content.code:
<!ATTLIST element-name attribute-name attribute-type attribute-value>


DTD example:


<!ATTLIST payment type CDATA "check">


XML example:


<payment type="check" />
content.code_html:
<!ATTLIST element-name attribute-name attribute-type attribute-value>

DTD example:

<!ATTLIST payment type CDATA "check">

XML example:

<payment type="check" />

content.text: The attribute-type can be one of the following:
content.html: The attribute-type can be one of the following:

content.code_html:
Type Description
CDATA The value is character data
(en1|en2|..) The value must be one from an enumerated list
ID The value is a unique id
IDREF The value is the id of another element
IDREFS The value is a list of other ids
NMTOKEN The value is a valid XML name
NMTOKENS The value is a list of valid XML names
ENTITY The value is an entity
ENTITIES The value is a list of entities
NOTATION The value is a name of a notation
xml: The value is a predefined xml value

content.text: The attribute-value can be one of the following:
content.html: The attribute-value can be one of the following:

content.code_html:
Value Explanation
value The default value of the attribute
#REQUIRED The attribute is required
#IMPLIED The attribute is optional
#FIXED value The attribute value is fixed

content.code:
DTD:

<!ELEMENT square EMPTY>

<!ATTLIST square width CDATA "0">


Valid XML:

<square width="100" />
content.code_html:
DTD:
<!ELEMENT square EMPTY>
<!ATTLIST square width CDATA "0">

Valid XML:
<square width="100" />

content.text: In the example above, the "square" element is defined to be an empty element with a "width" attribute of type CDATA. If no width is specified, it has a default value of 0.
content.html: In the example above, the "square" element is defined to be an empty element with a "width" attribute of  type CDATA. If no width is specified, it has a default value of 0.

content.code_html: <!ATTLIST element-name attribute-name attribute-type #REQUIRED>

content.code:
DTD:

<!ATTLIST person number CDATA #REQUIRED>


Valid XML:

<person number="5677" />


Invalid XML:

<person />
content.code_html:
DTD:
<!ATTLIST person number CDATA #REQUIRED>

Valid XML:
<person number="5677" />

Invalid XML:
<person />

content.text: Use the #REQUIRED keyword if you don't have an option for a default value, but still want to force the attribute to be present.
content.html: Use the #REQUIRED keyword if you don't have an option for a default value, but still want to force the attribute to be present.

content.code_html: <!ATTLIST element-name attribute-name attribute-type #IMPLIED>

content.code:
DTD:

<!ATTLIST contact fax CDATA #IMPLIED>


Valid XML:

<contact fax="555-667788" />


Valid XML:

<contact />
content.code_html:
DTD:
<!ATTLIST contact fax CDATA #IMPLIED>

Valid XML:
<contact fax="555-667788" />

Valid XML:
<contact />

content.text: Use the #IMPLIED keyword if you don't want to force the author to include an attribute, and you don't have an option for a default value.
content.html: Use the #IMPLIED keyword if you don't want to force the author to include an attribute, and you don't have an option for a default value.

content.code_html: <!ATTLIST element-name attribute-name attribute-type #FIXED "value">

content.code:
DTD:

<!ATTLIST sender company CDATA #FIXED "Microsoft">


Valid XML:

<sender company="Microsoft" />


Invalid XML:

<sender company="W3Schools" />
content.code_html:
DTD:
<!ATTLIST sender company CDATA #FIXED "Microsoft">

Valid XML:
<sender company="Microsoft" />

Invalid XML:
<sender company="W3Schools" />

content.text: Use the #FIXED keyword when you want an attribute to have a fixed value without allowing the author to change it. If an author includes another value, the XML parser will return an error.
content.html: Use the #FIXED keyword when you want an attribute to have a fixed value without allowing the author to change it. If an author includes another value, the XML parser will return an error.

content.code_html: <!ATTLIST element-name attribute-name (en1|en2|..) default-value>

content.code:
DTD:

<!ATTLIST payment type (check|cash) "cash">


XML example:

<payment type="check" />

or

<payment type="cash" />
content.code_html:
DTD:
<!ATTLIST payment type (check|cash) "cash">

XML example:
<payment type="check" />
or
<payment type="cash" />

content.text: Use enumerated attribute values when you want the attribute value to be one of a fixed set of legal values.
content.html: Use enumerated attribute values when you want the attribute value to be one of a fixed set of legal values.
